website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for cash-strapped classrooms and other live-presentation scenarios. The best quality for the lowest price.
cons: Does not fold neatly for travel

customer_reviews.title: Hindsight is 20/20
customer_reviews.text: This item works beautifully. It did not come with software so it needs to be downloaded online. I'm thankful that it is adjustable. HOWEVER, if you do not have a whiteboard, and need to use a projector in your classroom, consider getting a camera with a light. I didn't consider this and found out that I couldn't turn out my classroom light without turning on my lamp so that the item could be seen. Hindsight is 20/20, but this is exactly as described. I wish it had a light, but that is my fault for not researching the item first.
customer_reviews.author: JSM

customer_reviews.title: Scientifically Proven
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start...this is perfect for the classroom. I use it to show work I am doing in various documents that my students have at their desk. I use it to show progression of scientific on effects on various things. For instance, I showed a penny rusting. I performed the experiment with the document camera up and the students could see the process. I was able to take students through what was occurring. Students could see real time what was happening.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest or the clearest
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest or the clearest auto focus was too overactive and I can't use it. It was focusing in and out the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: A&P Mom

customer_reviews.title: The camera is easy to focus and adjust
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I'm so impressed with the quality and ease of use of this camera. One of my math students wanted to do online math tutoring, but online white boards have weird delays and are hard to draw on, and using my computer camera and a whiteboard didn't work either. Instead, we each bought the IPEVO Point 2 View USB camera and chatted over skype! The camera is easy to focus and adjust, and now we are both able to write on paper (with amazing clarity!!! pencil, pen, whatever) and work through math problems!! Thanks IPEVO
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great little Cam!
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Easy to use. Simply plug in and you're off. Resolution is excellant and it has really good magnification properties. It has no internal storage, but who needs it. You can record with software on your computer. It seems to work better with some software as opposed to others. You can download presentation software from their website. It's really easy to use and does a lot, but I had trouble sincing the audio with the video. It could just be my computer. Anyway, I'm using a free copy of Cyberlink Ucam and it's working great! Great resolution and does a lot for the money... Great buy...
customer_reviews.author: michael macchia

customer_reviews.title: Good picture, freezes sometimes
customer_reviews.text: It's a good camera, better than my school-provided projection device. However, when I have the IPEVO software up and plugged in, it will sometimes freeze my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: The application and program were very easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: The application and program were very easy to install and use. I had it set up and running within a few minutes and I think it will work well for my classroom. The only thing I am not entirely pleased with is the makeup of the product itself. It is made of cheap plastic and I worry that it will not even last me an entire school year. I will update this review after school starts.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: A good value for the price. Effective teaching tool.
customer_reviews.text: I teach drawing classes and have used this occasionally as a teaching tool (hooking it up to a room projector). It has a lot of nice features. I tried it in one classroom in which the lighting was hard to control. The image projected was washed out and hard to view. In another classroom, in which I could better control the lighting, the quality was excellent. I've worked with better projectors, but they cost three or four times more. This one is affordable and does a nice enough job to be used in a hands on, real time art class.
customer_reviews.author: Nils

customer_reviews.title: Great camera so far
customer_reviews.text: This small camera has been very useful in my classroom as a substitute ELMO device. The picture quality is good and the free app download was easy to install and use. My only gripe is that it didn't come with a lamp so I had to buy an additional light source so my students can clearly see the work when the overhead lights are dimmed for projection.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Still it works great, and it's decent while moving around
customer_reviews.text: Focus is a little hard to get right for doing anything active with it. I was doing a computer build live stream and trying to get shots of the connection sand such inside. Still it works great, and it's decent while moving around, but for the price it performed... It also requires an above-average amount of light. This was on Ubuntu 15.10 (Linux) and have since used it on my wintendo as well without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, effective
customer_reviews.text: I needed a document camera for the classroom and, as we all know, schools aren't exactly supplying much these days. Found this and it does exactly what I need it to with a low price tag
customer_reviews.author: Smulligan

customer_reviews.title: Audio video lag, no support
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera specifically to record written lectures. Online, the product said that it did not come with recording software, but there were many free online options, and they recommended Picasa. I have scoured the internet and tried 6 different recording softwares, and NONE OF THEM WORK. There is ALWAYS a lag between the audio and video, a lag that doesn't happen with my internal camera or other (cheaper) external cameras of lower quality. This camera is totally worthless for my purposes, and I've wasted almost a hundred hours trying to get it to work. No help on any webpages, no returning of emails.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Needs to have a clearer image.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my classroom. It works consistently on my computer. My only issue with the camera is that I have to constantly hit the focus button. It doesn't take much for the image to become blurry and then the camera doesn't readjust the image. Since I use this for a classroom, this sometimes can interrupt the flow of my lesson especially when I have to hit the focus button up to 3 times just to have a clear image.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Benigno

customer_reviews.title: I love the split screen function and snap shot
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera to do art demos. I love the split screen function and snap shot. I have not used it to record my demos as of yet so I can't speak on it. But I love everything so far. It small and easy to store away. I wish it had a light function but other then that I love it and it works well in my classroom. Set was super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Von G.

customer_reviews.title: Great job for a small price
customer_reviews.text: I've used document camera for many years. The prices have ranged from $800 - $5,000. Since I am back in the classroom, I remember all schools are not created equal and the technology I have used for years was greatly missed. I must admit, I was skeptical given the price. It was a great surprise to see the quality projected by such a small and low cost doc cam. This makes it afforadable for all teachers. It captures work as video and as pictures. Connected to a projector, it reduces the need for transparencies, making it good for the environment as well. Now I just need to find a low cost projector....
customer_reviews.author: 2 in College

customer_reviews.title: Great for pic of tiny stuff at work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it might be a waste of money, but was willing to try it for the price. Turned out to be one of the best additions to my picture taking stuff. It is easy to set up on Windows 7 (32 and 64 bit). Took a picture of edge of a $5 bill to test and the writing in the edge detail was very readable. Using it to take close up pictures of small parts for work. Then I can email the pictures so we are all taking about the same detail. Using primarily on parts smaller than 1/4" diameter. I am happy with this product. It was well worth the money and I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: frog

customer_reviews.title: It really depends on what you use it for
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product thinking it would help me with my circuit board build / repair. The idea was to use my laptop as a large display device with the camera providing the image. This way I could work on my fine pitch parts without having to look through a microscope. If you are trying to use the product like I did, then save your money you will be disappointed. Nonetheless, if you want to get a better picture of coins, stamps, things of that nature, then the product is a good fit for you. There are some useful and easy to use software features. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: habworks

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME presentation camera!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect for a $60 camera, but this one is amazing. I do online presentations and speak to large groups of people - showing my iPad and other tablets. I needed something easy to use that would give a clear picture. This one really fits the bill! It's easy to pack in my tech gear bag, and just plug in the USB to my laptop or desktop computer. Launch the easy-to-navigate software and you're up and running. The auto-focus button on the camera is a real lifesaver and it even projects well over the internet. So glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Cox

customer_reviews.title: Works as a webcam too
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box. Auto focuses pretty well. The adjustable arm allows you to simulate eye contact when video conferencing. This works well as a webcam (even though it's not hd, it's 2mp), just because of the versatility of the arm. Th plastics used in the the arm seem tough and the simplicity of the mechanism well like lend to it's longevity. The base is heavy enough for any angle.
customer_reviews.author: John M Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible investment for a teacher paying out of pocket
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Has never been in focus. Every time I move a paper it's out of focus. Terrible investment for a teacher paying out of pocket.
customer_reviews.author: robbi paynther

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these cameras for taking pictures of jewelry prior to repairs. It saves time as the pictures are easily loaded on to each computer decreasing the upload time it takes for us to get the pictures into our repair system. We find that the resolution of the pictures is great - showing damage on items we take in. Using the image on the screen as your guide takes a little getting used compared to the point and shoot we were used to since the image is reversed. However, there is a setting to flip the image and that does help a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the classroom teacher.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day when teaching (more than two years now) and prefer it over the bulkier models that I've used in the past! Would highly recommend. Don't wait to get this-- it's totally worth it. Also, if you download the software from the website it's updated from the disc that was provided.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Lancy

customer_reviews.title: Love it (works great on Linux)
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! I am a teacher, and I use this to make flipped classroom videos. It works great on Linux, which is a huge plus. The stand is very versatile, and the camera itself is just plain high-quality. I can't recommend this enough to anyone who wants a good value on a document camera. Don't drop hundreds of dollars on an Elmo when you could have this at a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: great for teahers
customer_reviews.text: I'm a math teacher and this is a very useful tool, I work problems on a paper with a marker, and project it to the white board. I combine it with a usb microphone, and my voice projects through the computer speakers. Great inexpensive setup. I also combine it with Google Picassa and record videos and insert them into my powerpoints that I share with students. I work challenging problems for students and record them via Google Picassa, which is free. Instruction on how to do this on the IPEVO website. Great deal, no problems or complains.
customer_reviews.author: Target

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, but the picture is pretty grainy and the software freezes and crashes sometimes. I used this in my classroom and it was very helpful, but I wish it provided a clearer picture.
customer_reviews.author: BeebzK

customer_reviews.title: Great for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I have one purpose for it and that is to use it in my classroom. It works wonderfully. My biggest concern is how long it will hold up. Then again, I didn't pay a lot of money for it. After reading all the reviews, I was sold. Once I hooked it up and started using it in my classroom, I was really glad I bought it. I am going to recommend it to my colleagues​.
customer_reviews.author: MsCoachBee

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.text: I am a former ELMO user. I transferred to a new school, and they didn't have an ELMO for me. I find this to be a pretty solid alternative. Yes, the images can project via the LCD and be a bit dark, but if you adjust the light in the room, it helps a lot. Also, I went to Target and bought an LED lamp with an adjustable neck that can be clipped on a desk, and that helps. I'd recommend this product to teachers who want a document camera, but don't have access to an ELMO.
customer_reviews.author: Teal Lover

customer_reviews.title: Classroom
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't a great choice for the classroom. Not may options for work with for display. But would do if nothing else available.
customer_reviews.author: Cleva Garner

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I use it most days as a teacher. It is very compact and versatile. It does not take up much desk space and conveniently needs only one plug, a USB port. The head can be taken off the stand and used for free hand projection.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Freezes up
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. My product does not work correctly. I thought it was a computer error, but after getting a new computer, I've realized it is the USB camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my projector in my classroom. It works very well. The picture is clear and the kids can see it just fine. I did figure out that you need to have a light source near the paper you have under the camera or it will cause a blinking to happen that is annoying. Once I put a small desk lamp by the camera it works great. This is so much better than using an overhead and transparencies!
customer_reviews.author: KLAS 94

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the camera to work straight out of the box. Connected to computer but just made a clicking noise and the image shown was just black, as though the shutter couldn't open. Missed the return window so trying to return to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: E. Densley

customer_reviews.title: If youre a teacher, you'll love this
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend (a high school teacher) will not shut up about how much she loves this. She uses it for all of her grading. It performs as advertised and the scanning process takes literally a second. It's so much faster than your typical scantron machine, especially if your school may be lagging a bit on technology. Though it may be a bit pricey, it saves so much time and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little document camera! I would recommend it to any teacher looking for a document camera. Two main features this is missing would be a light and a cable lock. The light is necessary because when you are projecting in a classroom, you usually have the overhead lights off. Easy fix is to use a desk lamp to illuminate the papers you are trying to project. The cable lock is necessary because technology tends to walk away in classrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive option for teachers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for use in the classroom, and I have been bragging about it for months. It does exactly what the more expensive models do, except perhaps not quite so perfectly -- you have to physically move the camera arm to "zoom," and it projects only one half of an 8 1/2 x 11 sheet at once. A major plus is its size--you can store it in a locked drawer after hours, it takes up very little table space, and it is light enough to be really easy to use and transport. The image quality is lovely, I have had no complaints from students. You need a laptop and an LCD projector... that is it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: It isn't the 16 by 9 ratio
customer_reviews.text: It is not a rectangle. I bought this product and started using it on youtube videos. It is a low-quality video resolution and it is a square. It doesn't fit any screens made after 1990
customer_reviews.author: student

customer_reviews.title: The stand is super steady and surprisingly hefty
customer_reviews.text: Use in my classroom everyday. It's simple to install and start using straight out of the box. The stand is super steady and surprisingly hefty. Several of my fellow teachers purchased their own camera's after seeing mine in use.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Noss

customer_reviews.title: Good, but only 480 lines.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. The stand is great. I would love it if the camera had 1080 resolution or even 720. I searched around before buying it, but couldn't find a newer Ipevo model with more resolution. 480 these days is pretty weak. I bought it anyway, and it has a place in my arsenal because of the stand, but really needs a resolution upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: amaquin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for taking pictures of items to sell on ebay and etsy. It does a good job for 3D objects. But does not work well for taking pictures of printed material. The auto focus is constantly zooming in and out. Need to turn off the auto focus. Pictures of printed material come out a little grainy. Pictures need to be taken in natural light or the colors will be off.
customer_reviews.author: John Urbanski

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love this doc camera. I’m a teacher and needed an inexpensive doc camera for my classroom. I read all the reviews and this camera is the best for the price. I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The camera itself is good and as a document camera its only good for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an example of you get what you paid for. I used this in my classroom and although it worked the further away students were the harder it was to see what was projected. Adjusting the distance between the camera and document caused other issues. The camera itself is good and as a document camera its only good for small groups, not a normal size classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Queen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year for school in May 2018. Used twice. Will not work at all this year.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect once you figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my classroom. You have to download the software to your computer in order to use it. It's perfect once you figure out how to use it. Students love it!
customer_reviews.author: takeisha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is great! Image is a little grainy, but that's to be expected. Only negative: For image to show up on my smartboard, I have to turn the lights out (not the camera's fault). However, when I do that, my room becomes pretty dark, and then you need light on whatever you are imaging. So, a cheap desk lamp might be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: foldable and pretty good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying using this little camera in my classroom. It is very handy, foldable and pretty good quality for the price. I can connect and disconnect it very easily. The only reason I give it four stars is that I would like to see a little bit more flexibility in zooming and resolution and brightness. all in all a good product for its price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Aghajani

customer_reviews.title: Best document camera you can find
customer_reviews.text: Best document camera you can find! I connect it to the computer and everyone can see it in the smart board. Have been using for the entire school year and never gives me any problem. Easy and fast to install
customer_reviews.author: cristie

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and does the job. Easy install. I got this to model document analysis for my students and it works great. Also, I like that I am able to display student work on a large screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little USB still camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly nice little USB camera for photographing small objects. The image quality is fine (for my purposes at least), the setup could not have been easier, and the image capture utility is straightforward and easy to use. There is not a ton of settings or fine adjustment on the camera itself, basically just the height from the object you're photographing, by moving the camera arm. The auto-focus works well though, and the software allows you to zoom, manually focus, and make other basic adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Limited capability
customer_reviews.text: Cool looking camera, but the arm limits the range of this camera. Mine is not able to capture a full ipad screen, which is already smaller than a normal sheet of paper. Additionally, it doesn't capture contrast well, so if you have a screen in the image, it will be blown out in the highlights.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Y.

customer_reviews.title: Super Camera for the Classroom!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice camera for the classroom. I teach one class for professional automotive technicians that involves one PC linked to two projectors in a double-wide classroom and it is so nice to be able to show small components and demonstrations to that many students simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my use. I regularly am away from home and am regularly helping my wife with her reading material at home so when needed, I remote desktop into her machine, she turns on the camera, and I can see exactly what she is looking at, helping her with translations or pronunciations.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - I bought this for my job!
customer_reviews.text: So, I needed a small camera at work that could sit and constantly read a weight value from a scale and relay it to two computers - this did the trick and works great! It was well worth every penny. Since the main computer it is connected to is running Windows XP, I could just run the built in video program and viola (I put it in the Startup file also).
customer_reviews.author: dklingen

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera for the price. Only negative is that since it is so light any vibration will make the projection shake. For best results and activation for iPad users you will need to purchase the Ipevo WS-01 wireless station and the Ipevo height extension set.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Easy, reliable, and does the job!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2 years now. It is easy to install, simple (plug and use) and it takes pictures quickly and they are in a review gallery to copy and paste quickly into a smart board document. Example- I take a picture of a student's writing journal, and I can copy and paste it into a smartboard doc and edit it right on the spot. Easy!!
customer_reviews.author: cafe11

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers stated, this camera is an excellent find especially for its inexpensive price. It has a very clear picture and all the functions I desire out of a document camera. I would recommend it to anyone who is in the market for a document camera but does not care of spend hundreds of dollars on something that essentially does the same things.
customer_reviews.author: HMW

customer_reviews.title: Terrible auto focus
customer_reviews.text: Biggest complaint--very often blurry and will not auto focus despite changes in lighting, distance from item, etc. Very annoying. When it works appropriately (50% of the time), it is really good!!
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Not so much if you're going to narrate and record
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this but when recording a video with narration about 10-15 seconds into the recording it's like it slows down and your coice gets deeper on playback.
customer_reviews.author: David E

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! saved hundreds of dollars. This company makes this camera for MANY OTHER tech companies and forensics brands. They charge hundreds more. I Plugged it right into my equipment and the locked down system recognized it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Any Man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase; necessary component to my classroom
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. Used it last year in another school and purchased it this year in my new school. By far the cheapest camera that is reliable out there. Extremely easy to install and takes up very little room on my desk. I would suggest getting an external light source. The camera has a lot of issues with focusing if you are in a room with little light. But for the price, it is an outstanding purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Walda

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. I have tremors and can no longer take ebay pictures with a handheld camera. This allows me to point the camera at the item and control it (zoom, focus, shutter) from the keyboard and the image is automatically stored in a pre-selected file. Easy to use, great software, excellent picture quality. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great device, great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the POV2 with OS X Snow Leopard. Setup is fast and painless and it "just works". In particular I'm using it for demoing iPhone and iPad apps. I recommend turning the autofocus from continuous to single if you're doing this because it keeps it from trying to refocus on your finger when you touch the screen. I've also seen one working with Windows so it seems to be a great device for both platforms.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Ezell

customer_reviews.title: It does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: For years, roughly half of my high school math students have told me that reviewing homework problems was really helpful for them. The other half have often said that reviewing homework takes way too long. This year I'm using the IPEVO Point 2 View camera to quickly display examples of student work. Students get the benefit of seeing a well worked-out problem without the time sink of a kid going up to the board and rewriting everything. It does what I need it to do at a much lower cost than most document readers. I've even used it to display the output of graphing calculators for an AP Calculus class.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Treadway

customer_reviews.title: Loved using this in my classroom
customer_reviews.text: Loved using this in my classroom. Let me interact with students directly via paper and pen, rather than relying on my Smartboard and other electronics that didn't alway work or were difficult yo navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Feikert

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Are use it for meetings at work it’s a great collaborative tool when you are using WebEx. I do wish I could save the camera settings, I have to change the camera settings every time I use it it defaults the upside down and backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Coach T

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice presentation item.
customer_reviews.text: This works but the knob broke off the first time I pulled it out of the holder. It still works, but it shouldn't be that flimsy. It projects papers and items nicely for my classroom. It is a lot cheaper than an Elmo. The overhead lights seem to mess up the autofocus which can be a bit annoying, but I have worked around that.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lockrey

customer_reviews.title: Where's the computer clip?
customer_reviews.text: I just got the camera today. I played around with it in the house and I like it. I bought it to use while teaching. However, there's no clip in the box. Every review I've watched about this camera had a clip included in the box, but mine didn't come with a clip. I feel kind of ripped off. I actually need the clip. How can this be resolved?
customer_reviews.author: A. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VIDEO CAMERA FOR PC
customer_reviews.text: Great video camera!! I love this one. I have Windows 7 Home pro and this works so well with it. It provides full-frame, high-quality video and I really love it. Worth the money I spent on it and more. RECOMMENDATION? OH HELL YES.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda_dagoba

customer_reviews.title: it's ok for now but i am going to purchase a better one next school year
customer_reviews.text: it's hard to figure out where to put the paper that you want to project on the screen. sometimes its flipped. there is also no built in light so you cant use it in low light situations. sometimes the software that you download freezes up. it's ok for now but i am going to purchase a better one next school year.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Works just as well as more expensive ELMO's and is portable. I use it in my classroom and I can juat plug it into any computer and project my notes onto the board.
customer_reviews.author: Mellymagne

customer_reviews.title: Good for viewing
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this item yet, but a friend has one and when we used it recently it was great and so easy to use. It was much better than having a camera on a tripod and trying to show people what we were doing at the sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for teachers!
customer_reviews.text: This document camera has a better image than both of the document cameras that our schools have been using. You can write on your Smart Board with it, which I couldn't do with the doc. camera I had. It was very easy to set up. Also, if I hadn't bought it, I would have had to invest in more desk lamps for my old camera because even with the lights attached to it, the image was extremely dark. Not with this! It doesn't have its own light but it doesn't need one unless you want to take images when its dark. I am so impressed with the price, the compact size, and how amazing it works!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: This item is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This item is great for the price. I did not want to spend a lot on a document camera for my classroom in case one of my students broke the item. So far, it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pennisi

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Clear view of documents
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Clear view of documents, however it is difficult to take a quality snapshot of a standard 8.5x11 paper. Better off scanning or taking a pic w/ your iPhone. Also, the software downloaded to the PC has frozen and/or crashed a few times when the camera has been on for extended periods of time. Ultimately, you get what you pay for. I feel there are probably better options out there, but you'll be paying more.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Video lags like a strobe
customer_reviews.text: Had to send it back. Inadequate for showing live manual demonstrations-- the video lags and lurches. I will try the replacement, but if it still has the same problem,(which the techs said it shouldn't) then I'll have to return it for good and get a better (more expensive) model camera. Good for still image and picture taking however. The USB plug-in feature is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L

customer_reviews.title: works as described
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a relatively cheap solution for creating live videos of hand written math solutions, as well as stills of documents. IPEVO P2V does this well. ;) When used with my video recording software (I use Jing mostly on my MAC), I can create the desired videos and stills.
customer_reviews.author: NJH51

customer_reviews.title: Best image camera by far
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC camera. Great image quality, very versatile. I'm looking to buy another one as my actual webcam because this document camera is so much better than what I currently have. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Do it all camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this USB camera to use on a podium Android/iPhone demos, for this goal it is perfect. But be aware that for Apple Mac computers it lacks drivers to control exposure etc. its mostly automatic.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality in resolution could be better. Currently using to display student work.
customer_reviews.author: K B

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT BE BEAT FOR THE PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 for our school. There is a learning curve but really can anyone argue with the quality to price ratio here. It compares very favorably with our school's document camera/projector. It is way more flexible (it can be moved and it works as a regular camera as well. Students love to see themselves making presentations. Great zoom and clarity. Definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Nice base, ok camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice, heavy base. Plasticky camera but works ok for my application (scanning app!). Nice and convenient multi-dimensional motion and reasonably quick focus controls. More importantly it works with direct show filters on windows.
customer_reviews.author: cchi

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera with good macro capabilities, low cost, good reviews, USB and software for minimal control. I was surprised at how well this camera is designed for the price. It simply works and has a great price point. I put my finger under it to see how good the resolution is and you can see my fingerprint ridges! I can send auto focus commands and snapshot commands from the computer. I'm really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would of spent a little bit more money for a better document camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheaper Doc cam but it gets the job done. Sometimes the software doesn't work and needs a reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: This document camera is very powerful for such a small size. I like the photo option and the auto focus. It works great in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my classroom every day. I love that it is small and durable and easy to use. The only downfall is that each time I write on the paperwork under it, the camera keeps refocusing itself and gets blurry at times. Other than that it is a great tool for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry McLemore

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I recently lost my precious IPEVO doc cam on a business trip -- and so I ordered two more of these little jewels, just in case I ever lose one again. As a national public speaker, I find that many hotels and conference centers will charge $200-$500 for a one-time rental of a document camera. Meanwhile, my bitty little IPEVO cost me just $70.00 and I bring it with me on the road every week. It's light, has a good image, and the software sets up perfectly in under 10 minutes. Among a world of often over-rated, super complex and costly tech tools, this is a true value.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Docu camera for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it! The price is great. The only reason it did not get 5 stars is because the base sometime tips over and we have to steady it with a book.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good for the price of the camera. It works well with the downloaded software. I wish it had its own light source.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna J Doskocil

customer_reviews.title: I use this camera at work to screen share my ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera at work to screen share my iPhone. It has a really wide range, though, so could probably be used for many other things.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good price for
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera to project my handwriting on a screen. I have to put the camera on a few books so it's high enough to view the entire paper, but this isn't too much of a hardship. I use the autofocus to allow the camera to focus one time on the paper, then I turn it off so it doesn't focus on my hand while I'm writing. There's a little bit of a time lag, but overall it does the job I want it to and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Woo Hoo!
customer_reviews.text: Love this document camera! I am a music teacher traveling to 4 different buildings and I don't have access to technology unless I purchase it myself. This device is tiny, easy to set up, and easy to use! Kids need visuals to reinforce their learning and this one is a gem! I just hook it up to a laptop and the laptop to a projector. A great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: 5jfarm

customer_reviews.title: more than what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! (I plug it into my laptop, which is also plugged into my projector, on my projector cart in my classroom.) I use in everyday in my classroom. My students are able to bring their work up to show their peers....they feel so proud! I also love how the camera detaches from the stand, so that I can project things around the classroom, even on-task students! Finally, the USB connect-ability relieves the need for another electrical outlet-awesome! You get more than what you pay for with this product!
customer_reviews.author: agua

customer_reviews.title: Small, Light weight, & works!
customer_reviews.text: The college where my wife is a professor, is not yet up to date on their technology and will not spend any money on upgrading their technology at the moment. They have a digital projectors but no good way for the teacher to be able to project an image and still point to items or mark on the page, like you could with the old overhead projectors. This item is a great low cost way to overcome that problem and small enough that the teacher can take it with them when they leave the classroom. It works just the way it is advertised and took almost zero effort to get it up and working.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ellis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier with this little cam! I’m an Art teacher and this was just so helpful with demos for my classes! Seller was very accurate in its description and it arrived quickly. Setup was easy and everything works perfectly! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna  Morris

customer_reviews.title: It's a cheap webcam. You get what you pay ...

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Document Camera Option
customer_reviews.text: My school did not have document cameras, and I really wanted one for my classroom. This was a good, inexpensive option for me. The quality isn't the highest, but it can get the job done if you're in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Batts

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Camera has developed a bad image after 45 days in use. I suspect it might be a shifted lens inside the unit due to poor manufacturing. I cannot recommend this camera.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for quick reference in my classroom
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it is adjustable and easy to use. Not sure I have tapped it's full potential yet, it's not always as bright or clear as I would like, but it works well for documents and other items to show my class. I will continue to try it in many situations.

product_meta.title: Ipevo CDVU-03IP Point 2 View USB Camera (Discontinued and Upgraded to IPEVO V4K)
product_meta.description: Size:2 Megapixel| Style:USB versionThe Point 2 View (P2V) is a USB Web Camera designed to free you from the usual screen-mounted web camera perspective. With its excellent 2 Megapixel resolution and unmatched versatility, the P2V will quickly become your favorite for video chats, business presentations, family photo sharing, and much more. The key to the P2V's wide range of uses is its unique stand. Featuring a solid weighted base and multiple joints, the P2V's stand allows the camera to capture anything and everything, from any distance and angle. Additional view options include the P2V's ergonomic grip - hold the camera like a pen, and literally point to view - as well as a universal monitor clip to attach the P2V to any standard laptop screen or monitor for a more traditional chat perspective. And with an unparalleled macro mode, you can take close-up video or snapshots - from as close as 2 inches (5 cm) away - for spectacular detail and clarity. The choice is yours. The P2V is fully compatible with most Instant Messaging applications, including Skype, Google Talk, Windows Live Messenger, Yahoo! Messenger, and AOL. Plus, the camera features cross-platform plug-and-play capability, and is easy to install whether you're a Mac or a PC user via any standard USB port
